data.event: The original settlement was founded as Mukhtuya (Мухтуя) in 1663 by Russian fur traders, on the site of an older Evenk settlement known as Mukhtuy.
In 1956, roads were built connecting Mukhtuya to the future Mirny and the port was established.

event.title: the future Mirny and the port was established

data.event: In 1956, roads were built connecting Mukhtuya to the future Mirny and the port was established.
On July 13, 1963, Mukhtuya was granted town status and was given its present name, after the river on which it stands.
